attributes.action: STOP BENEFIT DISCRIMINATION AGAINST MARRIED COUPLES
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
DESPITE MUCH TALK OF SUPPORTING THE ‘FAMILY UNIT', AND EVEN HAVING A ‘MARRIAGE DAY’; WHY IS IT IF YOU ARE A MARRIED COUPLE AND YOU, OR YOUR SPOUSE, LOSES THEIR JOB THEY HAVE NO ACCESS TO INCOME SUPPORT?

WHERAS, IF TWO PEOPLE ARE A ‘COUPLE’ BUT NOT ON PAPER; I.E. NOT MARRIED, AND LIVING IN SEPARATE ACCOMODATION, EVEN IF THEY HAVE CHILDREN TOGETHER, THEN THE PERSON WHO LOSES THEIR JOB CAN CLAIM INCOME SUPPORT OR JOB SEEKERS’ ALLOWANCE? 

SURELY THIS BOTH DISCRIMATES AGAINST MARRIED COUPLES AND DISCOURAGES PEOPLE FROM THINKING ABOUT LIVING TOGETHER AS A FAMILY WHEN THEY KNOW THEY WILL LOSE THEIR ENTITLEMENT TO BENEFITS SHOULD THE WORST HAPPEN.

rejection.details: Please address the excessive use of capital letters, they make the text very hard to read.
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
